entry.title: Combined summary - Multi CSV Transaction
entry.summary: On the bitcoin-dev mailing list, a user named Praveen Baratam has posted a question seeking clarity about how OP_CHECKSEQUENCEVERIFY (CSV) works in transactions. He has also provided an image depicting multiple CSV endpoints with different conditions at different delays and is interested in knowing whether it is possible to achieve this using OP_CHECKSEQUENCEVERIFY. The functionality of Bitcoin Script allows for nested IF statements and enforcement of different conditions in each branch. A contract written in Ivy called MultiCSV was provided as an example, which compiles to Bitcoin Script. The contract has three clauses for bobSpend, carolSpend, and bothSpend, each with its own set of conditions that must be met before unlocking the value.In the email thread, a member named Daniel Robinson replies that it is possible to use multiple CSV endpoints with different conditions and delays by using nested IF statements and enforcing different conditions in each branch with Bitcoin Script. He provides an Ivy script and the corresponding Bitcoin Script to demonstrate this. An image attachment of the multi CSV endpoint diagram is also included in the email. Overall, the discussion revolves around the usage of OP_CHECKSEQUENCEVERIFY (CSV) in transactions and how it can be used to achieve specific requirements.
